meanings.definition: A hormone secreted by the pituitary gland that stimulates milk production after childbirth.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how prolactins help mothers produce milk for their babies.
meanings.sent2: After giving birth, the mother's body releases prolactins to start milk production.
meanings.sent3: The prolactins in the body were like little helpers ensuring the baby had enough milk.
meanings.sent4: Her love for her child was so strong, it felt like her prolactins were working overtime to provide nourishment.
meanings.sent5: The prolactins danced through her system, signaling the start of a new chapter in motherhood.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of hormones with a similar structure and function.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the different prolactins to understand their unique roles in the body.
meanings.sent2: The group of prolactins work together to regulate various bodily functions.
meanings.sent3: It was as if the prolactins were having a party in the bloodstream, each with its own task.
meanings.sent4: The prolactins acted like a team, each member contributing to the overall well-being of the body.
meanings.sent5: The diversity of prolactins was fascinating, each playing a vital part in maintaining health.
